definitions.definition: (followed by 'with') Pregnant; large with young; full of.

definitions.definition: Impressive or striking.

definitions.definition: Much in use; favoured.

definitions.definition: Doing or exemplifying (a characteristic or pursuit) on a large scale; active or enthusiastic.

definitions.definition: Very good; excellent; wonderful; fantastic (from 1848).

definitions.definition: Intensifying a word or expression, used in mild oaths.

definitions.example: The chest pains were relieved by coronary stenting.

definitions.definition: An opening in a wall in a coal mine.
To yield to an overpowering force or overwhelming desire.
definitions.example: Thai culture as in many other Asian cultures, is succumbing to the influence of westernization.

definitions.definition: To give up, or give in.
To die.
definitions.example: succumb to pneumonia

definitions.definition: To overwhelm or bring down.
Any of the genus Klebsiella of rod-shaped bacteria, which cause many diseases in humans.
The cutting edge of a plow, typically a metal blade.
Too great or numerous to be computed.
definitions.example: The loss the National Library suffered from the fire is incalculable.

definitions.definition: Impossible to calculate.
Of a person's mood or character, etc.: impossible to predict.
definitions.example: He is incalculable when he's drunk. He can turn from an amiable person into a violent horror in a moment.

definitions.definition: Pearl-like, either in color or luster.
The act of a character speaking to themselves so as to reveal their thoughts to the audience.
definitions.example: At the end of the second act the main villain gave a soliloquy detailing his plans to attack the protagonist.

definitions.definition: (authorship) A speech or written discourse in this form.
(very rare) To issue a soliloquy.
Mamma; mother

(historical, often pejorative) In the southern United States, a black nanny employed to look after white children; or in the antebellum South, a female slave who was close to the household and looked after the children.
Anatomical uses.
Figurative uses.
Colloquial uses.
Strike with the beak.
Seize with the beak.
To play truant.
The Japanese art of flower arrangement.
An arrangement of flowers in this style.
Milk produced by human mammary glands.
A set of principles that are used in science or philosophy.
The name given by Aristotle's followers to his six works on logic.
Thoroughbred animals in general, but especially horses.
The breeding line of a thoroughbred horse or other animal.
An act of endearment; any act or expression of affection; an embracing, or touching, with tenderness.
A gentle stroking or rubbing.
To touch or kiss lovingly; to fondle.
definitions.example: She loves being caressed by her boyfriend.

definitions.definition: To affect as if with a caress.
To print with a stencil.
A work produced using a stencil.
An evil spell or curse.
A witch.
A spell (now rare but still found in compounds such as hex sign and hexcraft).
A hexagonal space on a game board.
A hexagon-shaped item of rock climbing equipment intended to be wedged into a crack or other opening in the rock.
To cast a spell on (specifically an evil spell), to bewitch.
The study of coins, tokens, medals and paper money
The study of coins
The collecting of coins, tokens, medals and paper money
The collecting of coins
To cause to become an element of something; to insert or fill.
To steep in a liquid, so as to extract the soluble constituents (usually medicinal or herbal).
To inspire; to inspirit or animate; to fill (with).
To instill as a quality.
To undergo infusion.
definitions.example: Let it infuse for five minutes.

definitions.definition: To make an infusion with (an ingredient); to tincture; to saturate.
To pour in, as a liquid; to pour (into or upon); to shed.
Strict vegetarianism; the practice of eating neither meat nor other animal products, such as fish, milk and milk products, eggs, and honey.
A way of life which strictly avoids use of any kind of animal products and services that are based on exploitation of living animals.
A belief that is against the killing of animals for meat consumption; the antithesis to carnism.
Any non-woody flowering plant that is not a graminoid (a grass, sedge, or rush).
Habitually lazy, procrastinating, or resistant to physical labor
definitions.example: The indolent girl resisted doing her homework.

definitions.definition: Inducing laziness
definitions.example: indolent comfort

definitions.definition: Causing little or no physical pain; progressing slowly; inactive (of an ulcer, etc.)
Healing slowly
Any substance that glows under the action of photons or other high-energy particles
Several bird species in the Botaurinae subfamily of the heron family Ardeidae.
The liquor remaining after halite (common salt) has been harvested from saline water (brine).
The saline substance added to soy milk to coagulate it as a primary step in the production of tofu.
A very bitter compound of quassia, cocculus indicus, etc., used by fraudulent brewers in adulterating beer.
An area alongside a quay.
An instance or period of roaming.
The announcement of a forthcoming marriage (legally required for a church wedding in England and Wales and read on the three Sundays preceding the marriage).
Historically, any public announcement of a coming event.
definitions.example: The Banes which are reade beefore the beginninge of the playes of Chester, 4 June, 1600.

definitions.definition: Any of several perennial composite plants, especially of genera Cirsium, Carduus, Cynara, or Onopordum, having prickly leaves and showy flower heads with prickly bracts.
This plant seen as the national emblem of Scotland.
This plant used as a charge.
The Order of the Thistle, or membership thereof.
To arrange or score music for performance by an orchestra.
To compose or arrange orchestral music for a dramatic performance.
definitions.example: Sergio Leone orchestrated "The Good, the Bad and the Ugly".

definitions.definition: To arrange or direct diverse elements to achieve a desired effect
definitions.example: Orchestrated histories are not fact-based.

definitions.definition: A behavior or way of thinking that is characteristic of a person.
A language or behaviour that is particular to an individual or group.
A peculiar individual reaction to a generally innocuous substance or factor.
A peculiarity that serves to distinguish or identify.
definitions.example: He mastered the idiosyncrasies of English spelling and speech.

definitions.definition: A nonessential amino acid C4H8N2O3 found in plants such as asparagus.
